content:
• Thursday, March 31, 2016

  • After Hours Gainers / Losers

    • Top gainers, as of 5.25 p.m.: URBN +4.0%. HMY +2.9%. DEG +2.1%. KGC +1.5%. SBS +1.5%.
    • Top losers, as of 5.25p.m.: GNCA -10.1%. MAR -4.8%. HOT -4.5%. MRVL -3.5%. PRMW -3.4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:40 PM
  • VIA

    Report: Shareholders dropped suit over Redstone pay, will still seek it

    • Shareholders have dropped a lawsuit that charged CBS (CBS +1%) and Viacom (VIA +2.4%, VIAB +2.9%) with letting Sumner Redstone remain chairman of the companies despite alleged mental unfitness, but they still intend to seek damages through some avenue.
    • The lawyer handling that case says some or all of Redstone's compensation ($28M/year in 2013 and 2014, and $4M in 2015) should be returned to equity holders. "We have pursued another course of action, dealing with CBS and Viacom through other means."
    • Redstone left the executive chairman post at both companies in early February, just two weeks after the lawsuit was filed in January.
    • In the separate petition filed by Redstone's ex-girlfriend Manuela Herzer, Viacom chief Philippe Dauman and Sumner Redstone's daughter Shari Redstone are set to testify under oath in the coming week.
    • Now read What's Holding Back Viacom? Â»
     
     
     
     
    | 4:50 PM
  • MAR

    WSJ: Anbang to back way from Starwood bid

    • Anbang is going to walk away from the merger battle for Starwood Hotels & Resorts (HOT), according to a report from The Wall Street Journal. More details are expected out from the publication shortly.
    • After-hours trading check : HOT -4.6%, MAR -4.5%, IILG -1.0%.
    • Now read Starwood Investors Dancing As Competing Bids Drive Up Value
     
     
     
     
    | 4:23 PM | 6 Comments
  • BHC

    Moody's downgrades Valeant's credit

    • "Considering the operating risks associated with a difficult pricing and reimbursement environment, Valeant's (VRX -3.3%) credit ratios -- including debt/EBITDA in excess of 5.0 times -- place the company more appropriately at the B2 rating level," says Moody's SVP Michael Levesque.
    • No action is taken on Valeant's Ba2 senior secured rating, but that rating, along with all other credit ratings for the company, remains under review for further downgrade.
    • Now read: 6 Investing Lessons From The Valeant Pharmaceuticals Scandal (March 29)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:41 PM | 52 Comments
  • DLNG

    Dynagas LNG secures new time charter contracts

    • Dynagas LNG Partners (DLNG +16.3%) surges after signing an extension and twoÂ new long-term time charter agreements for a pairÂ of liquefied natural gas carriers.
    • Following the new Lena River and Ob River time charters, DLNG says its minimum contracted revenue backlog has increased to $1.2B from $586M, and the average remaining minimum contract duration has climbed to 7.9 years from 3.7.
    • DLNG estimates the new contracts will generate ~$34M/year in aggregate net cash from operations.
    • DLNG also says it will maintain its current level of cash distribution.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:37 PM | 10 Comments
  • TGB

    Taseko Mines says shareholders should reject Raging River proposals

    • Taseko Mines (TGB -2.5%) files a letter to shareholders urging them to vote against Raging River's proposals to replace three board members, the latest in the company's nasty proxy fight with the dissident shareholder group.
    • "You cannot trust what RRC says about Taseko," the letter says. "RRC's disinformation campaign is being managed by experienced raiders to distract shareholders with smears about insider trading and service fees from the real issue," which the company says is RRC's plan to "enhance bondholder returns at the expense of long-term shareholder value."
    • Now read Raging River seeks change at Taseko Mines
     
     
     
     
    | 3:03 PM | 10 Comments
  • GNCA

    Genocea: Cowen sees massive upside

    • Cowen reiterates Genocea (NASDAQ:GNCA)Â with a rating of Outperform and a price target of $40. Implied upside 607%.
    • Firm says data suggests that vaccination with GEN-003 is as effective as daily antiviral therapy at preventing the recurrence of lesions through 12 months.
    • Cowen believes GEN-003 has a greater than $700M sales potential, says that Genocea is "significantly undervalued."
    • Now read:Â What I Like About Genocea
    • Earlier:Â Genocea Bio's genital herpes candidate GEN-003 shows strong effect in mid-stage study; shares up 38% premarket
     
     
     
     
    | 2:39 PM | 9 Comments
  • EGN

    Energen could be near sale of Delaware property, analyst says

    • Energen (EGN +4.7%) could be close to selling its 31K non-core Delaware acres for as much as $300M-plus, which could boost the stock, SunTrust analysts say.
    • "A strong Permian sale could cause the company to pull its San Juan proposed sale, as the proceeds combined with the recent $381M equity offering should be more than ample for upcoming activity," SunTrust writes.
    • The firm says the company could increase spending on drilling and completions above $250M if the non-core Delaware Basin package is sold for more than $300M, which also would reduce the urgency for other asset sales.
    • SunTrust raises its price target for Buy-rated to $43 from $30.
    • Now read Energen shows signs of stress with an ill-timed 24% share count expansion
     
     
     
     
    | 2:36 PM
  • ACRS

    Aclaris continues hair loss therapy-stoked up move; shares rise 17%

    • Thinly traded micro cap Aclaris Therapeutics (ACRS +16.5%) breaks out today on modestly higher volume. Shares have climbed almostÂ 22%Â since Monday when the company announced that it acquired global rights to certain Janus Kinase (JAK) inhibitors for the treatment of hair loss and other dermatological conditions via its acquisition of Vixen Pharmaceuticals who licensed the intellectual property from Columbia University.
    • The deal included an upfront payment, future milestones and royalties on commercial sales. No specific financial details were disclosed.
    • JAK inhibition is an approach used to treat cancer and inflammatory diseases. Examples of approved JAK inhibitors are Pfizer's (PFE -0.3%) XELJANZ (tofacitinib citrate) for rheumatoid arthritis and Novartis' (NVS +0.2%) Jakafi (ruxolitinib) for polycythemia vera and myelofibrosis. Researchers at Columbia discovered the link between JAK inhibition and hair loss.
    • Now read Aclaris Therapeutics: A Sizable Market There For The Taking
     
     
     
     
    | 1:33 PM
  • WWE

    Macquarie: WWE facing concerns as WrestleMania 32 arrives

    • Ahead of its flagship event on Sunday, WrestleMania 32, World Wresting Entertainment (NYSE:WWE) is trading 1.5% lower, and Macquarie is expressing concerns about the stock.
    • One is subscribers. The WWE Network launched in the UK in January 2015, adding a number of international subs, but "We were never given a subscriber number at January's Royal Rumble," says Macquarie's James Clement. "If this figure was favorable, we have a feeling it would have been disclosed."
    • In addition, not only might WrestleMania be weak on storylines -- four of six superstars in the big matches aren't full-time wrestlers -- it's competing on a tough sports weekend, with the NCAA Final Four and championship game, and MLB's Opening Day. "There may well be a limit to the number of hours WWE's target demographic is able to spend in front of the TV screen without irritating their parents, spouses or significant others," Clement says.
    • Now read Demystifying WWE's Business Â»
     
     
     
     
    | 1:32 PM | 5 Comments

  • Corn tumbles after bearish USDA report

    • U.S. farmers plan to sow 93.6M acres of corn this year, up 6.4% from a year ago, the most since 2013, and against expectations for just 89.97M acres. Corn stocks are at 7.808B bushes vs. the trade estimate of 7.801B.
    • Soybean plantings are expected to total 82.2M acres vs. 82.65M a year ago. Wheat planting are pegged at 49.559M acres vs. 54.644M acres a year ago.
    • USDA reports
    • Corn is down 3.7%, while beans and wheat are marginally higher.
    • CORN -4.15%
    • ETFs: CORN, JJG, WEAT, SOYB, GRU, WEET
    • Now read: CORN: An Attractive ETF Alternative To Cash
     
     
     
     
    | 12:48 PM | 6 Comments

  • Midday Gainers/ Losers

    • Gainers: SKYS +107%. PRQR +26%. GNCA +25%. MDVN +24%. ACRS +18%. PAR +17%. EVLV +17%. STAF +16%. GLBL +16%. OTC:PRKR +15%.
    • Losers: LIFE -19%. AZUR -15%. LIME -14%. MFCB -12%. AXSM -11%. ARGS -11%. NNVC -8%. PBFX -8%. GTE -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:46 PM
  • GRUB

    GrubHub expands delivery service to Detroit

    • GrubHub (GRUB +5.2%) has expanded its food delivery service again, this time to Detroit.
    • The company has offered online ordering from more than 250 restaurants in the city since 2012; now it's launched its turnkey delivery service there.
    • GrubHub delivery has spread to nearly 50 markets since its summer 2014 launch.
    • Now read Is GrubHub Finally Worth A Bite? Â»
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM
  • TEUM

    Elephant Talk +4.4% as fiscal 2015 revenues grow 52%

    • Elephant Talk Communications (ETAK) is up 4.4% after an earnings report where fiscal year revenues rose 52% Y/Y and the company launched a winter restructuring.
    • Net loss was $5M for the year, compared with a loss of $21.9M the year before, mainly driven by the full release of $11.6M in deferred revenue from a terminated contract with Iusacell.
    • Total billings were $21.3M, while total revenues were $31M.
    • In restructuring, headcount has gone from November's total of 264 employees to 199 today, and the company expects to have 160 employees by Q2's end.
    • The company is likely to use its conference call to talk about options for divesting ValidSoft after a previous plan fell through.
    • Conference call to come at 11 a.m. ET.
    • Now read Elephant Talk Gets New Management To Execute A Turnaround Â»
     
     
     
     
    | 10:01 AM
  • VALE

    Vale says Mitsui is not revising Mozambique coal venture terms

    • Vale (VALE +1.6%) says partner Mitsui (OTCPK:MITSY, OTCPK:MITSF) has no plans to revise terms of a coal venture project in Mozambique, as reported by a local newspaper.
    • Vale says a recent decision to reduce the accounting value of assets in the project "does not directly impact Mitsui's investment decision" in the project, and that the companies are working to conclude long-term financing for the venture.
    • Mitsui could reduce its planned investments in the projects and change the terms of a project finance contract, originally expected to reach $2.7B, according to the local report.
    • Now read Mitsui forecasts first loss since 1947 amid $2B in writedowns
     
     
     
     
    | 9:56 AM

  • Canadian GDP surprises to the upside

    • Real GDP rose 0.6% in January, and was higher by 1.5% Y/Y. It was the fastest monthly GDP gain since 2013, and the quickest annual pace since February 2015. Economists had expected January growth of just 0.3%.
    • "Today's monthly GDP report is perhaps the most encouraging in recent memory," says TD Bank's Brian DePratto. Noting four straight months of GDP gains, BMO's Doug Porter says this isn't a "fluky rebound-type bounce."
    • Porter says the annualized GDP growth rate over the three months ended in January was 5%.
    • The loonie (NYSEARCA:FXC) adds further to this year's gains,Â up 0.6%Â on the session to $0.7761. In mid-January, the loonie was buying just $0.6866.
    • ETFs: EWC, CNDA, EWCS, FCAN, QCAN, HEWC
    • Now Read: The Looniness Of The Canadian Loonie And Oil Sands (March 30)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:46 AM | 2 Comments
  • GNCA

    Genocea Bio's genital herpes candidate GEN-003 shows strong effect in mid-stage study; shares up 38% premarket

    • Thinly traded micro cap Genocea Biosciences (NASDAQ:GNCA) is upÂ 38%Â premarket on robust volume in response to its announcement of positive results in a Phase 2 clinical clinical trial assessing GEN-003 for the treatment of genital herpes.
    • GEN-003 showed sustained and statistically significant reductions in the rate of viral shedding compared to baseline, with reductions in genital lesion rates of 43 - 69%, depending on the dose and time frame.
    • A Phase 2b study was recently initiated. Virologic efficacy data should be available in Q3 and clinical efficacy data by the end of the year. An end-of-Phase 2 meeting with the FDA is expected in Q1 2017.
    • GEN-003Â is a T cell-directed immunotherapy (therapeutic vaccine) designed to elicit both a T cell and B cell (antibody) response to herpes simplex virus type-2 (HSV-2). It licensed theÂ Matrix-M2 adjuvantÂ from Novavax (NASDAQ:NVAX).Â Genital herpes affects ~400M people worldwide.
    • Now read Genocea's GEN-003 Reviewed By An Immunologist Â»
     
     
     
     
    | 9:25 AM

  • Premarket Gainers / Losers as of 9:10 am

    • Gainers: GNCA +35%. MDVN +15%. MNOV +8%. GLBL +8%. LEU +7%.
    • Losers: PBFX -9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:16 AM
  • BTU

    Peabody Energy to cut jobs at Powder River Basin coal mine

    • Peabody Energy (NYSE:BTU) says it plans to lay off ~235 employees from its North Antelope Rochelle mine in the Powder River Basin which straddles Montana and Wyoming.
    • After the reductions, which affect ~15% of the workforce at the mine, BTU's Powder River basin operations will employ ~1,500 workers, of which 1,150 will be at North Antelope.
    • BTU says the U.S. coal industry has seen unprecedented shipment declines this year; heating degree days YTD are 17% lower than last year, with March heating degree days down nearly 30% vs. the 10-year average.
    • BTUÂ +2% premarket.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:11 AM | 5 Comments
  • MDVN

    Medivation up 11% premarket as analysts weigh in

    • Medivation (NASDAQ:MDVN) is upÂ 11%Â premarket on increased volume this morning. Credit Suisse maintains its Outperform rating and says the company could be takeover candidate at a value as high as $75 a share, although its price target is a more pedestrian $49 (31% upside).
    • Yesterday, Goldman Sachs initiated coverage with a Neutral rating and $44 (18% upside) price target. Barclays maintains its Overweight rating and $48 (28% upside) price target.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:07 AM
  • CIO

    City Office REIT slips after secondary offering

    • The comapny sold 7M shares at a price of $11.40 each for gross proceeds of $79.8M. The underwriter greenshoe is for another 1.05M shares.
    • CIOÂ -2%Â to $11.37 premarket
     
     
     
     
    | 8:02 AM
  • AIG

    AIG higher after United Guaranty files for IPO

    • AIG's mortgage insurance unit filed for an IPO last night, listing a placeholder amount of $100M to be raised. The operation had just shy of $1B in revenue in 2015, and net income of $360M.
    • Prospectus
    • The expected move is part of management's plans to answer activist demands without going through a full breakup of the company.
    • Updated investor presentation
    • SharesÂ +1.95%Â premarket
     
     
     
     
    | 7:59 AM | 4 Comments
  • MOV

    Movado -3% post Q4 results

    • Movado (NYSE:MOV) reports net sales rose 10.1%Â on a constant currency basis in Q4.
    • Gross margin rate improved 220 bps to 52.5%Â primarily driven by a favorable shift in channel and product mix, selective price increases and certain sourcing improvements.
    • Operating margin rate increased 150 bps to 9%.
    • Inventory dropped 4.9% to $162.5M.
    • FY2017 Guidance: Net sales: $585M to $600M; Operating income: ~$65M to $70M; Tax rate: 32%; Net income: ~$43.3M to $46.7; Diluted EPS: $1.85 to $2.
    • MOVÂ -3.10%Â premarket.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:12 AM
  • SORL

    More on SORL Auto's Q4

    • SORL Auto (NASDAQ:SORL) reports international sales dropped 11% to $15.3M in Q4Â due to lower commercial vehicle production and currency depreciation in several overseas markets.
    • DomesticÂ aftermarket sales squeezed 13% to $16M.
    • Domestic OEM customers sales fell 7.6% to $25.5MÂ due to lower sales of trucks in the quarter.
    • Gross margin rate declined 50 bps to 27.2%.
    • Operating expense rate declined 600 bps to 13.8% due toÂ reduced G&A and R&D expenses.
    • FY2016 Guidance: Net sales: ~$200M; Net income: ~$11.5M.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:02 AM | 1 Comment
